item.title: Loop Optimizations in compilers[Part 1]
item.description: Introduction Loops are “the” most compute intensive part of any software program making loop optimizations some of the most rewarding optimizations for a compiler. In this post, I’ll try to go over some of these optimizations which are covered by LLVM(I’m sure you’ll find them in other compilers too). This is not an extensive list you can always find more. Loop Invariant Code Motion (Code hoisting) It’s a known coding practice to always keep definitions and constant code outside the loop.

item.title: Using git worktrees to manage large codebases
item.description: As the first blog in the series let’s keep it short and informative. Introduction If you work on a large scale project like compilers you will always come across the need to have multiple versions as a part of your development arsenal. One might be the latest one(in sync with upstream), one might be for a brand new feature you are working on and the other might be some crash issue that you are investigating.
Hi, I’m a compiler engineer currenlty working at Machine Learning and Software Engineering(MLSE) @AMD. I try to write stuff related to compilers and software development
